availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.collection: Assistant Adjutant General Letter Book - No. 1 ; 5 Sept 1863 - 2 Feb 1864

body.p:
187
Oct. 26th 3
Serg. R. Parker -- Co. (C.) 21st Ky. Vols
Baracks No 1 --
Nashville=Tenn.
Sir,

Your communication to the Governor, has been referred to this office, and I am compelled to answer that you must go back to your commands when ordered. The officers are the best judges when a parole is valid or worthless -- and in your case, it is certainly worthless.

Respectfully
Your obt serv't
John Boyle
Adjt. Gen. of Ky.
